revised_title: X-ray Measurement of the Diameters of the Living Eye: Techniques and Findings
tldr: The authors describe a technique using X-rays to measure the diameters of the living eye and provide findings from measurements of 45 eyes. They discuss the relationship between the diameters and the axial length, as well as the volume of the eye. The study helps to understand the shape and size of the eye in different refractive groups.
